reviews.text: I’ve visited this place many times, and it never disappoints. It’s a pure vegetarian restaurant and one of the best spots for Indian food in Ujjain. The food is always fresh and flavorful. There’s ample space for dining in, and the ambience is decent. Located at a prime spot in the city, it’s definitely worth a visit.

Updating my comment based on recent visit -

I visited this restaurant multiple times with my family. The interior is good. The rates of dishes are almost the same as compared to other restaurants. The taste is also good. Nowadays they have restructured their interiors, due to which if you're coming with a group of more than 6 people then you'll be congested.

Earlier around 10 people can sit easily but now if someone comes with more than 6 people then it makes them really uncomfortable. In my recent visit, manchurian served was not good. Paneer tikka, sweet corn, hara kabab is good.

I had a fantastic dining experience at New Raja restaurant The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and the food was absolutely delicious. The menu had a great variety, and everything we tried was fresh and flavorful. The service was friendly and attentive, making the evening even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place for a wonderful meal.

reviews.text: I went for lunch to have chicken biryani. There was no customer present when I visited. The staff took 15-20 mins to prepare my order. The taste is good. In nearby cities, the same dish is ordered at a low cost with a higher amount of quantity. People here are not that fond of non-veg like other cities. So rates need to be restructured in the menu.
Service is very fast and quality is good. Food was tasty and with reasonable prices.

name: SKYROOF RESTRO UJJAIN
address: Mhakal Vanijya Kendra, opposite Cosmos Mall Road, Nanakheda, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text: Excellent Food, The Paneer and Tandoori Roti were here top class, highly suggested. The service was extremely good, very polite behaviour staff. They did a small error in accuracy of order but they quickly responded positively and apologizes for that. Theme of the restaurant was very attractive, it will match your expectations pretty much. Have a go here with your family and friends.

Skyroof is a cozy rooftop café and restaurant in Ujjain, offering a charming ambiance and an intimate vibe. My sister recently hosted a get-together here for 20 people. While the rooftop isn’t very spacious, it accommodates around 40-50 people, making it ideal for small gatherings.

The food left me with mixed feelings. The starters were excellent, bursting with flavor, and undoubtedly the highlight of the meal. However, the main course—vegetable dishes and dal—was just average and didn’t quite match the expectations set by the starters.

The biggest drawback, unfortunately, was the service. It was noticeably slow, and the staff seemed inattentive despite multiple requests. This aspect could use significant improvement.

On the brighter side, the rooftop vibe was enjoyable and made the evening pleasant despite the slow service.
The hotel's food was excellent. From the fresh ingredients to the skillful preparation, each dish was a culinary delight

name: Rudraksh Club & Resort
address: 4QGV, + 7VC, Ujjain - Indore Rd, near Navgraha Mandir Triveni Sangam, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
We stayed here just for one night, mainly to sleep after a long day. Unfortunately, the central AC wasn’t working properly, and by 2 AM it had completely stopped. Even before that, the cooling was poor. We had to call and complain to get it fixed, which disrupted our rest.

What made things worse was the attitude of the staff. At checkout, no one acknowledged our inconvenience. The manager had no idea about the issue, and the front desk staff were indifferent—as if handling complaints with silence is part of their daily routine. Not even a basic apology was offered.

We checked in late (around 10 PM) and left after breakfast. All we wanted was a peaceful night’s sleep, but even that wasn’t delivered. Definitely not the experience you expect from a resort of this standard.

I am writing to express my deep disappointment with my recent experience at this property (Rudraksh Resort Ujjain). Unfortunately, my stay was far from the standard one would expect from a hospitality establishment, especially one charging premium rates.

My experience began at the reception, where I arrived at approximately 10:30 PM, hoping to find a reasonable deal for a short stay—less than 12 hours, as I planned to check out the next morning. However, I was informed that the entire resort was sold out and that even if rooms were available, they would be charged at a non-negotiable rate of ₹8,000. I was also told that staff had been instructed to sell rooms at escalated prices. I found the tone and manner in which this was communicated quite unwelcoming and lacking the courtesy expected in the hospitality industry.

Subsequently, I booked a room online through Cleartrip for ₹6,500—a Superior Room. Upon returning to the property, I was told the room I booked was not available and that I had been "upgraded" to a Superior Deluxe Room. While I initially appreciated the gesture, the upgraded room was in a poor and unacceptable condition—unclean and poorly maintained. I immediately requested to be placed in the room I originally booked.

Eventually, I was allotted the original category, but the room did not match the images shown online. It lacked basic amenities like bedside lamps and looked significantly different from the photos, which I was told "may be outdated." It was clear to me, however, that the pictures online were recent and more flattering than the reality.

I raised the issue again with a senior staff member, who then offered another upgrade to an Executive Room. By this time, it was around 11:15 PM, and I was extremely fatigued from the entire ordeal. The Executive Room, too, was disappointing. It appeared old and worn-out—the furniture was stained and had hair from a previous guest, the toilet was not properly cleaned, and overall cleanliness and quality of the room were far below acceptable standards. I have photographic evidence to support these claims.

Given the premium pricing, I strongly believe that basic standards of hygiene, maintenance, and service should be upheld. Unfortunately, that was not the case.

Later that night, I visited their cafe, which I was informed operates until 2:00 AM. I ordered Hakka noodles and a classic veg pizza. The noodles were average, but the pizza—after a 20-minute wait—was served with an overwhelming amount of mozzarella cheese, making it inedible. When I requested to cancel the pizza, I was told it could not be canceled and could only be remade. At that point, given everything that had already transpired, I had no desire to wait another 20 minutes. After a prolonged and frustrating conversation involving multiple staff members, the item was eventually canceled.

Overall, this was one of the worst hospitality experiences I have encountered. The quality of the rooms, lack of cleanliness, and dismissive customer service are not reflective of the standards expected from a resort of your repute. I would not recommend this property to others unless significant improvements are made in both quality and service delivery.

Extremely poor service. There is a certain amount of arrogance without providing any quality service. I wonder why they call this a five star hotel. There is no covered parking and no even an iota of shade available.

Food are over fairly priced compared to the quality they provide.

Really not happy staying here. Would suggest checking the alternate which is 2 km far from this with much better facility and food choices.

name: Hotel Abika Elite
address: 4 2, Nazar Ali Marg, Nijatpura, Malipura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
The hotel stay was good overall. The staff behavior was excellent, and the taste of food was amazing, especially the breakfast, which had a wide variety of tasty options. The outdoor area was well-maintained and clean.

However, the rooms need some repairs, particularly on the flooring and in the washrooms, which could improve the overall comfort.

The stay felt a little expensive, but considering the service and food quality, it was satisfactory.

The location is close to the major temples. The rooms are quite spacious and clean as well. The quality of food and variety is great, excellent service by the staff (all of them - reception, restaurant and housekeeping) especially the housekeeping support by Mukesh.

We stayed for two nights. Good reception staff
Housekeeping was pretty decent.
We used the hotel taxi and our driver Mahesh was excellent.
We ate at the restaurant Lotus, the food was good and staff attentive and friendly. A special mention to Karuna who looked after us really well.
The rooms are a little tired and the linen was not the cleanest but overall was good enough.

name: Solitaire Hotel & Resort
address: Chintaman Road, Jaysinghpura, near Jantar Mantar, infront of Gyan Sagar Girls Academy, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel.
The building is very old and poorly maintained.
The washrooms were not clean at all, which was extremely unhygienic.
There were a lot of mosquitoes in the room, which made it impossible to sleep.
Insects were crawling around the room, including near the bed.
The air conditioner in my room was not working properly.
Despite informing the staff, they did not take any action to fix it.
The landline phone in the room was also not functional.
I had no way to contact reception without going all the way downstairs.
This was very inconvenient during the night.
The biggest issue was the noise from the neighboring rooms.
Guests in the adjacent room were making noise all day and night.
There was loud music, shouting, and banging on the walls.
Hotel management did nothing to control the disturbance.
I complained multiple times but they ignored it.
It felt like the hotel had no rules or supervision.
I couldn’t sleep properly even for a single night.
This completely ruined my trip.
The overall cleanliness of the hotel was very poor.
Dust and stains were visible in many corners.
Even the bedsheets didn’t look freshly washed.
There was a constant bad smell in the room.
This hotel is not worth the money charged.
I would strongly advise against staying here.
Definitely not recommended for a peaceful or hygienic stay.

Private part hard DJ even at 10:30 pm will not let you sleep . If you are booking to sleep and visit temple fresh next morning don’t book . No support even after requesting to slow down music or reduce bass

name: Gaurison Hotel&Resort
address: Gram Sanwara Khedi, Sanwara Khedi Simhastha Bypass Road, New RTO Road, near by Ashtvinayak Temple, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with a recent hotel booking made through your platform Gaurison Hotel and Resort, Ujjain. This is Dharmshala and not resort.

The hotel was advertised as a 4-star property, but the reality was far from it like Dharmshala. The condition of the hotel was extremely poor—more comparable to a 1-star establishment. The rooms were inadequately maintained, unhygienic, and had a persistent foul smell. Basic amenities were missing:
No room service or in-house restaurant
No refrigerator in the room or anywhere on the property
No complimentary drinking water provided
The swimming pool was dirty.
The parking facility was inconveniently located 1 km away from the hotel
Additionally, the washrooms were unclean and the premises lacked regular housekeeping.
This experience was extremely disappointing and not aligned with what was promised at the time of booking.
Comfortable & spacious & well cleaned rooms. Staff's behavior is polite. However kitchen is not working during my stay. Otherwise all is good.

I visited this property on 16th April and had a terrible experience. We booked two rooms — one room's door wouldn't open and the washroom jet wasn't working. We paid ₹2700 for that room. In the morning, someone brought tea and sandwiches we never ordered. When we refused to pay for it during checkout, the front desk guy misbehaved and threatened us. He even spoke rudely to my husband and me. They just add extra charges to increase the bill. This place looks nothing like the pictures. I wouldn’t recommend anyone to stay here. Worst experience

name: Hotel Shriram Ujjain
address: Malipura Road, Near Bus & Railway Station, Dewas Gate, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
A Wonderful Stay at Hotel Shree Ram (Ujjain)

I recently stayed at Hotel Shree Ram (Ujjain)and had an exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming and made me feel right at home. The check-in process was smooth, and they even offered me a complimentary drink upon arrival.

The room was spacious, modern, and immaculately clean. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the view from my window was breathtaking. The bathroom had high-quality amenities.

One of the highlights of my stay was the on-site restaurant. The food was delicious, with a great variety of options for all tastes.

The hotel’s location is perfect, with easy access to nearby attractions and public transport.

Overall, I had a fantastic stay at Hotel Shree Ram and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. I’ll definitely be back for my next trip!

name: MPT Avantika, Ujjain

reviews.text:
I checked into the hotel on the 19th. I had to visit Mahakal and Omkareshwar, so I left my luggage at the reception and informed the manager that I would return at night. I specifically requested that my room be made ready by then and that my luggage be placed in the room, so that everything would be in order when I returned and there would be no inconvenience.

When I came back at 12:15 AM, only one room was ready, and the second AC deluxe room was neither ready nor did anyone seem aware of it. The night staff said that the morning staff didn’t inform them, and in the morning, when I brought it up, I was told that the night staff should have handled it.

Secondly, there was no tea/coffee maker in the room, even though it was mentioned as a facility in the AC deluxe room. The price difference between the two rooms was quite significant, but both rooms looked the same from the inside—so what was the benefit of paying more?

In the kitchen, there was only one staff member cooking and one steward delivering the food. The service was extremely slow. This place needs a lot of improvement so that such a beautiful property, located at such a prime location, can be utilized to its full potential.

It seems that because this is a government property, the staff is not paying proper attention to service and maintenance.

Infrastructure is good. Though it is old architect but really attractive. Need to improve some repairing work related to AC standards room:  the front door, kitchen ( cooler tap) , In reception area the switch and fan regulator, sofa or chair cover , need repairs AC or replaced.
Location is So nice and peaceful outside the main city area.
Food is awesome, nice quality if you want to replace some crockery than good otherwise okay.
Delux room is spacious.
Improve AC standards.
Prices is affordable and low compared to others.
Otherwise everything fine nice stay for me.

name: Pushpa Mission Hospital
address: Maria nagar, Dewas Rd, Rishi Nagar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
My mother recently got admitted at Pushpa mission hospital in June 2025 month first in ICU and then in private room. The doctor Dr. Jayvardhan Varma is very good expert doctor. However, I have very bad experience with the most of the nurse staff(Private room) handling my mother case on day to day basis. Most of the nurses are either trainee or they simply dont have been taught how to talk or respond with respect. Following points shows their insensitivity:
1. Whenever asked abt the patients BP value range being taken, they simply try to ignore first. Then being asked again, they still will not tell the range. Does the kin of patient dont have right to ask this basic info.to know the current status of patient health??
2. They come to room and ask the kin of the patient to give the 4-5 different tablets at certain interval during the day..my straight forward question here is if mistakenly by fault the kin gives overdose of some tablet or forget to give one..who should be held responsible for this???
3. Some of the nurse staff give arrogant (rude) answers & looks to any query being asked regarding the patient health in polite manner. If one is properly educated & in nursing profession then how one should respond to a polite question??? It was very frustating many a times for me to bear their rudeness...what if I could also have done the same in response to their rude answers leaving aside my politeness???? But I have kept patience till last...
4. A nurse forgotten to give saline scheduled during the day time..so she literally came at midnight(12 pm)saying she has missed it during the day and now will put on the saline...How one can forget it???? Do patient has no right to sleep in night after so many doses, saline and injection during the day??
5. When Saline are being put..ideally it is duty of nursing staff to come and check if the saline is complete or not( to avoid air or blood from veins getting up)...but all the time..myself have to monitor it and press the bell button which toobwas on extreme corner of room.
6. The response time after pressing the bell was very slow..one has to press the bell button a couple of times for someone to come and attend the case when needed. Most of time, nurses were busy chit-chatting in their main room.
7. The medicine prescribed by doctor or the bill to be paid for any test downatairs during the course of the day should be either given in one go or atleast a couple of times...it happened like I had to go downstairs at the billing or medicine section 4-5 times leaving behind the patient...who will take care of the patient if the kin is being told many times to go downstairs...why not only a couple of times????

Nursing profession is very caring and kind profession in which admitted patient is being treated very kindly. It is absolutely unacceptable if the caring staff displays rude gesture and talk like they are the bosses, even if they are confronting a polite individual. "WHAT IS TRUTH REMAINS  A TRUTH " and the god has seen that there..whatever I have said is what I have experienced, no doubt about it, even my review is not taken seriously. But ignoring it will simply malign the image of the hospital as this will happen again and again to someone in near future. The nursing staff must be given thorough training first and foremost on "How to behave or respond in polite manner".
Few nurses were kind and polite in answering, but some seemed filled with arrogance & lack of mannerism.
Its upto management of Pushpa mission to understand the gravity of situation. Ignore or respond and please take steps to train nurses to speak in polite kind way and not to throw their responsibilities on kin staying with the patient. My mother had been admitted to Room no. 219

Worst hospital I have ever seen. Also the doctor Rekha Chandwani. Here I delivered my baby in 2023 and had a most scary experience of my life. They treat you as if you have done some crime. They mentally herrase you and doesnt provide good care.
Please dont plan going in this hospital.

- Nurses require additional training in communication skills for interacting with patients and their families.
- There is a lack of available doctors at night, leading to increased responsibilities for nurses during handovers.
- Staff are unfamiliar with the use of xylocaine for numbing during procedures.
- There is a significant delay (3-4 hours) in informing or interacting with families after delivery.
- Documentation errors, such as incorrect dates, are present.
- Overall, there is a perceived lack of compassion and cooperation among staff.

address: 4QWV+6F4, Ujjain - Indore Rd, Vasant Vihar, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text:
Ujjain engg College is one of the most prestigious engg college of Madhya Pradesh. Also have new boys and girls hostal separate.
You will be disappointe to see building which is aged but well educated professors specifically in mechanical development.
College recently celebrated her golden jubilee in 2017. There having a play ground and big land.
In last campus facilities is also there, in which major company like a TCS, WIPRO UTTAM GELWA etc. But don't much expect from campus bcz it come time to time. But TCS having come every year. Which is select no of student every year.

I have my M.E. degree from here. All below is my perspective as a master student.
Talking about infrastructure it's painful to to see your college in such a poor and horrible condition. However after present principal Dr. Umesh Pendharkar took over charges to his position the college got a nice paint job but you can still find gaps between walls and columns at various classrooms. Many computers still runs on pirated window. Only in this year mid 2017 they manage to buy softwares like Ansys , Staad pro., etc while they are conducting M.E. in computer aided structural design and drafting for over 10 years. Lab for geotech and transportation is quite average you can manage to do all the practicals but can't say the same about structure lab. College placement for civil students is like a ghost, never heard of any company came for civil engineers but for other branches like cs, ec, elec and chem. they got fair nos. of companies. Faculties here are no doubt very knowledgeable, but they don't have time and their teaching method is also very poor if you compare it with the teaching method of renowned professors from IIT like Dr. Pradipta Banerjee. In my experience of three semesters of M.E. with 13 academic subjects, only in 1 subject we got our complete syllabus covered and that subject too is taught by a guest faculty Maheshvari Sir. And when you move to your dissertation in fourth sem you find that no professor has any useful knowledge regarding softwares other than Staad pro. and Autocad. And they don't support creative and innovative thought, in my case I have been assigned to a guide who is PhD in Geotech while I'm a structure student. This college is surely very poor choice for doing master degree. However for B.E. in civil it's still an O.K. choice.

If you take admission using GATE score then they will make you work for the department consultancy , yeah you read it right the civil department here also run consultancy and master degree students are made to do most of the jobs like concrete design and testing otherwise they won't approve your attendance thus make you disqualify for that month's GATE stipend.

In case you don't have much money to spend on education then this college is good because fees is pretty less.
I went to play football with my friends and the ground is pretty good! You can also play cricket or any other sport, but it gets a little crowded after 8 in the morning.

This shop used to be the one stop shop for our jewellery shopping a decade ago. Sadly we were badly fooled. Most of the jewelry bought from them is 18 carat which was said to be 22carat (916 as the owner said). Nothing bought was hallmarked, no certificate. After a decade when I got my jewellery scanned under an X ray scanner I got shock of my life. I learnt a lesson of my life and decided to put this review as I dont want others to get fooled. Beware people!!!
Bad god

Even on the day of purchase, the bread lacks durability, and after just one day, it transforms into a collection of crumbs, leaving consumers with an unsatisfactory experience.

Despite the bread concerns, the cakes at Bakers Lounge maintain their appeal, being both delicious and affordable. This positive aspect contrasts with the disappointing state of their bread. Moreover, the bakery's advantageous location adds to its overall attractiveness.

To enhance customer satisfaction, it may be beneficial for Bakers Lounge to address the issues surrounding the quality of their bread, ensuring that it aligns with the standard set by their other offerings. name: Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
address: inside Mahankal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
A divine and unforgettable experience at Mahakaleshwar Temple! 🙏🕉️

Visited Mahakaleshwar Temple last Friday with family, and it was truly a spiritual journey. We drove 🚗 from Indore to Ujjain – a smooth 2-hour drive. Thankfully, we had already booked our entry tickets online 🎫. A helpful tip: make sure to carry a printout🖨️ of your entry pass, as mobile phones 📵 are not allowed inside the temple premises.

The darshan of the Jyotirlinga – the only south-facing Jyotirlinga – was a powerful and divine moment 🔥. It is believed that Lord Shiva manifested here as a pillar of fire, and standing there in the sanctum felt truly sacred 🙇‍♂️.

After darshan, we took a walk through the temple corridor 🛕, which showcases beautiful stone statues 🗿 of Lord Shiva’s various incarnations. The whole area was clean, peaceful, and well-managed 👍.

There are proper arrangements to deposit your chappals/slippers 👡👞 near the temple entrance and clean drinking water 💧 is also available inside.

Highly recommend every devotee of Lord Shiva 🕉️ to visit this sacred place at least once in their lifetime.
Har Har Mahadev! 🙌🕉️

One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, a place of immense spiritual energy, and a must-visit for Hindu pilgrims. Well managed, mainly the newly built Mahakal corridor and the facilities for devotees.  But lack of helpdesk or volunteer guidance. Bhasma Aarti, a unique early morning ritual, involving the offering of ashes to Mahakal. There will always be a rush however online boling is available including 'sheeghra darshan' at Rs. 250/- and many other Pujans. You can book for 'Rudrabhishek', dedicated Pandit will be assigned to do that. There is no specific dress code to enter the temple. Don't miss the 'Durlabh Darshan Kendra' at Mahakal corridor, a unique experience.

What should I mention about the place is the abode of Devo ke Dev Mahadev. The jyotirlinga is the only jyotirlinga which is South faced and it is believed that sacred sites where Lord Shiva is believed to have manifested as a pillar of fire. The devotees of Shiva are blessed and at least try to visit once. Chappals and slippers can be dropped inside temple entrance facilities there and even the facilities of drinking water is also there.
Har Har mahadev 🕉️

name: Shri Kaal Bhairav Temple, Ujjain
address: Bhairavgarh, Goyala Buzurg, Madhya Pradesh 456003, India

reviews.text:
I recently visited this temple, what really caught my attention was the offering of liquor as prasad to the deity. 🤯

Though there was a bit of a crowd but the waiting time was absolutely worth it. I also saw people tying sacred threads on the railings, praying for their wishes to come true.

The vibe was peaceful and the whole place felt spiritual.
—————————-
Curious to know more? Read below the full story 👇🏻

Where liquor is offered to deity as prasad, and no one knows where it goes!

Located on the banks of the river Shipra, in the middle of a Hindu cremation ground, Shree Kal Bhairav in Ujjain is a six-thousand-year-old temple. The temple is five kilometers away from the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga. It is said that one’s visit to Ujjain is incomplete without a trip to this temple.

Surprisingly, there are no dry days at the Kal Bhairav temple, as liquor is offered to the deity as prasad. The priest sitting in front of the deity pours liquor into a plate and places it near the deity's mouth while chanting mantras in Sanskrit and performing tantrik rituals. The plate is tilted slightly, and the liquid gradually begins to vanish. Within a couple of minutes, the god can consume as much as a quarter bottle, even though there is no visible opening in the deity’s mouth.

The liquor offered to the deity forms one of the five rituals of tantra – Madya (liquor), Mans (meat), Meen (fish), Mudra (gesture), and Maithun (copulation). Although several other deities across India receive alcohol as prasad, such as the Kali Mata temple in New Delhi and the Khabees Baba temple in Lucknow, only Kal Bhairav is supposed to possess the mysterious power of drinking liquor, and it remains a mystery where the liquid ends up.

Several archaeologists and scientists have made multiple attempts to unveil this mystery. Even during the British period, the entire temple was excavated to determine if the liquid flowed into a cavity, but the mystery remained unresolved. Some claimed that the porous stone used to carve the deity could absorb alcohol, but this theory has been disproven. Others suggested that the alcohol evaporates into the atmosphere, but the rate at which the deity consumes the alcohol does not support this argument. Devotees believe that Lord Kaal Bhairav himself drinks the alcohol, and the prasad returned to the devotees is said to have healing powers that can cure various ailments.

Outside the temple, liquor shops offer a variety of brands, where both men and women queue up to make their purchases. Hundreds of devotees visit the temple daily, some as pilgrims and others out of curiosity. The temple complex houses a Deepstambh adorned with oil lamps lit on special occasions.

We are in queue for 2-3 hours. As it was a Sunday the temple was very crowded. But the final darshan was very peaceful. Felt blessed.

The Kal Bhairav Temple in Ujjain is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Kal Bhairav, a fierce form of Lord Shiva. The temple's story is intertwined with mythology and local legends, particularly involving a clash between Brahma and Vishnu and Shiva's intervention as Kal Bhairav. It's also known for the unique ritual of offering liquor to the deity.

The divine Kaal Bhairav Temple was a 30 mins ride from the city of Ujjain. Located at the outskirts of the city, this place has a different vibe altogether! Had visited the temple on an auspicious weekend and the waiting queue was almost 1.5 hours but the crowd was very well managed and moved faster than expected. There are plenty of shops and 2 liquor stores outside this temple where you could buy the Aarati thali and other puja essentials.

The crazy part is there will be children selling water bottles by sitting on the dividers of the standing queue where you can buy water if you don’t have one!

Tip- If you’re visiting for the first time and in the day time, do carry a cap or dupatta to cover your head as it’s very sunny during the summers and you’ve to wait in a long queue if there’s rush.

name: Shree Harsiddhi Mata Shaktipeeth Temple
address: Harsiddhi Marg, Harsiddhi Chauraha, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Harsiddhi Temple in Ujjain is one of the most revered Shakti Peethas in India, deeply rooted in Hindu mythology and spiritual tradition. Located close to the famous Mahakaleshwar Temple, it is dedicated to Goddess Harsiddhi, an incarnation of Goddess Durga. The temple holds significant religious importance and is believed to be the spot where Goddess Sati’s elbow fell, making it a powerful spiritual site for devotees.

The architecture of the temple reflects the Maratha style, with its striking red tower (shikhara) and intricately carved structures. The presence of the Sri Yantra, symbolizing divine feminine energy, and an ancient well within the premises adds to its historical and mystical appeal. The temple is especially famous for its two majestic deepstambhas (lamp pillars), which are lit with hundreds of oil lamps during evening aarti, creating a divine and captivating ambiance.

Visitors often describe the experience as spiritually uplifting, especially during Navratri when the temple is beautifully decorated and crowded with devotees. The temple is well-maintained, easily accessible, and offers a peaceful atmosphere despite its popularity. Whether you're a devotee or a traveler interested in cultural heritage, Harsiddhi Temple offers a memorable and soul-stirring experience.

Hara Siddhi Mata temple was built by King Vikramaditya in honor of the femine divine energy. According to Siva Puranam One of the Shakthi peethams where the elbow of Goddess Sati is believed to be fallen.
Morning 7.00-7.30 and evening 6.30-7.30 temple authorities lighten diyas which looks amazing and happy. Devotees also light diyas infront of the temple where space given. Some Devotees perform abhisheka to Lord Siva linga which was present In the premises. We visited at the time of Sivaratri.

The Harshidhhi Mata Temple in Ujjain is a revered Shaktipeeth, steeped in mythological and historical significance. It is believed that the elbow of Goddess Sati fell here, making it one of the 51 sacred Shaktipeeths in India. The temple showcases striking Maratha architectural influences, evident from the towering deepstambhas (lamp pillars) that are beautifully lit during festivals. These tall lamp pillars, built by the Marathas, are rare architectural elements not commonly found in other Ujjain temples. Inside the sanctum, the idol of Harshidhhi Mata is flanked by idols of Annapurna and Mahalakshmi, forming a unique trinity of feminine power. A lesser-known fact is that the temple gained prominence during the reign of the Maratha rulers who renovated and elevated its status as a central shrine in Ujjain. The temple is located near the famous Mahakaleshwar Temple, forming a spiritual circuit for pilgrims visiting Ujjain. Local traditions include lighting 1,000 oil lamps on Amavasya (new moon) nights as an offering to the goddess. The peaceful courtyard and minimal commercialization around the temple create a serene spiritual experience for visitors. Beyond religion, the temple is a symbol of feminine strength and the region’s syncretic cultural heritage.

name: Bharat Mata Temple, Ujjain
address: 5QJ9+8MX, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
The Bharat Mata Temple in Ujjain offers a unique and thought-provoking experience, quite different from the typical temple visit. Instead of deities, this temple is dedicated to the personification of India as a mother goddess – Bharat Mata. Stepping inside, you're immediately struck by the imposing and intricately carved statue of Bharat Mata herself, holding a map of undivided India.
The atmosphere within is less about traditional religious fervor and more about patriotic reverence. It evokes a sense of national pride and historical awareness. The walls are adorned with depictions of significant figures and events from India's history, offering a visual journey through the nation's past. While it might not be a place for conventional worship, it serves as a powerful reminder of the country's rich heritage and the sacrifices made for its freedom.
The temple complex is generally well-maintained, and the serene environment allows for quiet contemplation. It's a place that encourages reflection on the unity and diversity of India. For those interested in history, culture, and a different perspective on national identity, the Bharat Mata Temple in Ujjain is definitely worth a visit. It provides a refreshing and meaningful experience beyond the usual pilgrimage.

address: mandir, Angareshwar Mahadev(43/84), Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
This temple is considered as Original Birth Place of Mangal(Mars).
People those have Mangal Dosha(evil Mars effect) they offered puja with curd rice to minimize evil effects of Mangal.
We also performed our puja on 18-04-2025,21-04-2025 and 22-04-2025.
The temple has nice atmosphere.
Here you can do pooja for all your planets like Rahu, Ketu, Mangal , Kalsarpdosh and every planet whichever is weak in your kundli.

Angareshwar Mahadev is one of the most famous temples for Mangal-related poojas, believed to remove obstacles and negative influences. The ₹2100 pooja we performed was conducted very well by a knowledgeable pandit ji, who explained each step thoroughly.

To avoid traffic, it's best to take a right turn before entering Ujjain Gate. The temple also has a goshala, adding to its peaceful environment. While Pitra Pooja is done at Siddhvat, one should be mindful of charges, as poojas start from ₹100-200, but we ended up paying much more than needed.

Angareshwar sees a huge crowd, and the pooja process moves quickly. As soon as one group completes their rituals, another takes their place. Even at the Shivling, multiple people perform pooja together, followed by another group almost instantly. While this rush is inevitable, it’s something to be aware of when visiting.

Despite the crowd, the spiritual energy here is strong, making it a must-visit for those seeking relief from Mangal dosh and other obstacles.

Even though there were many people, the surroundings still offered a peaceful space for prayer and reflection. It’s a meaningful visit if you’re in Ujjain, but be prepared for a bit of a crowd.

This sacred temple, a revered Shaktipeeth, is dedicated to Goddess Kalika and serves as a source of spiritual energy, inspiring individuals to engage in virtuous acts and cultivate a deeper understanding of spirituality.

As the name suggests "4 Dhaam Temple", it's got God statues of all 4 dhams in the country. It's also got a small cave and other beautiful idols as well. Clean, peaceful, beautiful, and natural beauty as well ❤

reviews.text: Mangalnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is believed to be the birthplace of Mars (Mangal) according to the Matsya Purana. The temple is famous for its serene environment and the panoramic view of the Kshipra River. Spiritual significance and beautiful view of the Kshipra River.

Really liked this place. Located by the Shipra River, it has a calm and spiritual vibe. It’s believed to be the birthplace of Mars (Mangal), and as per lokkotha (folk belief), pujas here help reduce Mangal dosh. The surroundings are open and airy, and the temple feels powerful yet peaceful inside. Some priests may suggest special pujas, but overall, the experience felt genuine. A must-visit if you’re into astrology or want a quiet, divine atmosphere.

name: Mangal Temple Ujjain | Mangal Dosh Puja Ujjain
address: Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
I recently visited the Mangalnath Temple, which is located quite far from Nanakheda. You will need to pay around ₹100 for an auto to reach the temple. This place is especially known for the Mangal Shanti Pooja. As I am Manglik, I came here for the pooja. There are three types of poojas offered:

Normal Pooja - ₹1100, with an additional ₹200 for the receipt.

Medium Pooja - ₹2100, with ₹200 for the receipt. This pooja takes around 1 to 1.5 hours.

Complete Pooja - ₹5100, with ₹500 for the receipt. This pooja takes about 3 hours, and during it, you get "married" to a plant.

The Puranas claim that Mars is Earth’s child. In other words, Mars is a planet that evolved from Earth. According to Hindu myths, Mangala is created when Lord Shiva melts. According to Mahant Rajendra Bharti, the name “Ugra” refers to the planet Mars’ natural name. Astrology is based on the twelve zodiac signs, planets, constellations, etc.

The Mangalnath mandir is dedicated to Lord Mangalnath.   Most of the people who are having Mangalik dosh comes here and does puja for the Mangalnath deity.    The temple is two layered and with steps you have to reach the temple in the top .   The lower level is used by the pandits to do the puja and also there is a permanent havan going on with woodden log in the area abetting the main temple.   A new tower is built recently like a minar with colourful sections an added attaction of the temple.   Beware of pandits they will quote various charges after completing the puja .  Have all inclusive charges fixed before starting the havan.

name: Shree Mahakal Mahalok Ujjain
address: 5QH9+QP8, Mahakal Lok Corridor Rd, Begampura, Bagambag Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text: Mahakal Lok in Ujjain is a divine and grand place, enhancing the spiritual experience of devotees visiting the Mahakaleshwar temple. The beautifully crafted statues and pillars narrate stories from Lord Shiva's life, creating a powerful spiritual vibe. The corridor is vast, clean, and well-maintained, making it perfect for a peaceful walk. Evening lighting adds a magical touch, making the entire place glow with devotion. The management ensures smooth darshan and provides ample facilities. Overall, Mahakal Lok offers a soulful experience, making it a must-visit for every devotee and tourist.

A Divine Journey to the Heart of Shiva:
Stepping into the Mahakal Corridor in Ujjain is akin to embarking on a profound spiritual pilgrimage, even before reaching the sacred Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga itself. This magnificent expansion truly elevates the devotional experience, preparing the mind and soul for the divine presence of Lord Shiva.
From the moment you enter through the grand Nandi Dwar or Pinaki Dwar, a sense of sacredness envelops you. The sprawling pathways, meticulously designed and well-lit, guide devotees with grace, allowing for a comfortable and immersive journey. What truly sets this corridor apart is the breathtaking array of intricately carved sculptures. Over 100 divine stories of Lord Shiva unfold before your eyes, each a testament to ancient wisdom and artistic mastery. Walking amidst these depictions, chanting "Jai Shree Mahakal," feels like traversing through the very legends of the cosmos, connecting deeply with the divine Leelas of Bholenath.
The 108 ornate sandstone columns, each adorned with the divine 'Trishul' and various 'mudras' of Lord Shiva, create an aura of reverence. The 192 statues and 53 murals further enhance this immersive experience, making the path to the main temple a visual and spiritual feast. One can't help but feel a palpable sense of peace and positive energy radiating from every corner.
Beyond the aesthetic beauty, the corridor's thoughtful design facilitates a smoother darshan experience, even amidst large crowds. The seamless blend of divinity, comfort, and heritage preservation is truly commendable. The gentle sounds of temple bells, the murmuring of sacred chants, and the flowing Kshipra River nearby all contribute to a serene and tranquil atmosphere, making it a powerful preparatory journey for the ultimate devotion at the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga.
For any devotee of Lord Shiva, the Mahakal Corridor is more than just an approach to the temple; it is an integral part of the spiritual odyssey. It allows one to absorb the essence of Mahakal, to reflect on His boundless glory, and to arrive at the sanctum sanctorum with a heart brimming with pure devotion. It is a testament to faith, a bridge to the divine, and an experience that truly nourishes the soul. A must-visit for every seeker of blessings and spiritual enlightenment.

Lovely area. Majestic monuments. Various glimpses of Shivas life. Very good facility and food counter available. Government has made excellent arrangements for senior citizens and people with difficulty in mobility. Free electric vehicles are available to ferry them from gate to the Temple and and route one can see the entire mahaloka. Staff and driver all very very humble there was no wait time during the weekdays.

Whether you’re visiting for religious purposes or just to soak in the beauty of the surroundings, Ram Ghat offers a blend of divinity and tranquility. The well-lit area in the evening, along with the gentle breeze, makes it a great place to sit and unwind. Definitely a must-visit if you’re in the area!

The Nagchandreshwar Temple is located in Ujjain, India. It's a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its association with the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga, one of the twelve revered Jyotirlingas. Devotees visit this temple to seek blessings and offer their prayers to Lord Shiva. It's known for its unique architecture and the presence of a naturally formed shivling (a symbolic representation of Lord Shiva) surrounded by numerous serpents.

reviews.text:
Ujjain, considered to be one of the holiest cities of India, is an ancient city situated on the eastern bank of the Shipra River in the Malwa region of Madhya Pradesh. Ujjain is one of the four sites for the Kumbh Mela, the largest peace-time gathering on the planet that attracts 100 million people to the festival.

This makes Ujjain an important place of Hindu Pilgrimage. To add to that, it is also home to the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga, one of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines to the god Shiva. Ujjain is one of the most glorious cities of ancient India as it was also known to be the educational hub of various Indian scholars. The immense wealth of Ujjain in terms of religion, architecture, and educational value makes this is a top attraction amongst not only Indian travellers but also amongst foreign tourists as well. Ujjain is located at a distance of 52 km from Indore, which is also the nearest major airport.
